title: Roseline492
author: Roseline492
content: The man who received the very first Bitcoin transaction from Satoshi Nakamoto, Hal Finney was absolutely involves on the earliest public Bitcoin days and deserve some credit for a greater believer in the system and confident to Satoshi. Hal Finney died from ALS (Lou Gehrig disease) on 28 August 2014.

comments.author: ImThour

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Roseline492 on August 28, 2023, 01:37:56 PMThe man who received the very first Bitcoin transaction from Satoshi Nakamoto, Hal Finney was absolutely involves on the earliest public Bitcoin days and deserve some credit for a greater believer in the system and confident to Satoshi. Hal Finney died from ALS (Lou Gehrig disease) on 28 August 2014.Hal Finney was an uncommon cryptographer and computer scientist. He is an inspiration to many because he was one of the few that embraced Bitcoin when Cryptographers were seen as clueless noobs. He contributed a lot to the development of bitcoin and predicted that it would make many millionaires in the future. Even when he was diagnosed with Lou Gehrig's disease, he still spent his last days working on different crypto projects that benefitted the community. He is seen by many as the inventor of bitcoin but nobody has proved that assumption. His body is still been preserved through cryonic freezing because he and his wife Fran believe that that he can be brought back to life in the future. This might look impossible to many people but both couples always believed in the impossible. May his soul rest in peace until he achieves his goal of resurrection.

comments.author: Aikidoka
comments.body: I was aware of Hal, but I hadn't realized he had passed away. May his soul rest in peace; he truly deserves credit for his beliefs in Bitcoin and his support of Satoshi Nakamoto. As one of the early Bitcoin supporters, he played a such a big role in its foundation. If he were still with us, I am confident he would have continued to advocate for Bitcoin even more passionately, potentially making a positive impact on the cryptocurrency's development.Sadly he passed away and left our bitcoin community. May god rest his soul and I hope bitcoin will get more supporters in the future and I hope it'll get such a bright future.

comments.author: iBaba
comments.body: My goodness, coming in contact with this thread makes me sober. On how life on earth is ephemeral and the only the only true treasure we have on this earth is the lasting memory we have of our efforts and fulfillments on the surface earth.Indeed, it is a major achievement to remember the late Hal Finney, one of the early Bitcoin pioneers who played a critical part in the cryptocurrency's early days, receiving the very first Bitcoin transaction from Sir Satoshi Nakamoto himself. Hal Finney's confidence in the system and trust in Satoshi's vision are absolutely admirable. Unfortunately, he died, but his contributions to the growth and development of Bitcoin will be remembered forever.Adieu Late Hal Finney!
